intro: Sisymbrium humile var. piasezkii, commonly known as the narrowleaf winter cress, is a herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats and has small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture. It is characterized by its short stature and is often found in alpine or steppe environments.
